intro: Wissadula costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican starfish plant, is a succulent species native to Central America. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that are typically fleshy and spiky. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are often white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Wissadula costaricensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
